instructions.1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease and flour a 11x7 inch jelly roll pan or cookie sheet.
instructions.2: In a large bowl, mix together flour, 1/2 cup SPLENDA®, milk powder, baking soda, and pumpkin pie spice. Stir in pumpkin puree, eggs and egg white, and lemon juice. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Spread the mixture evenly.
instructions.3: Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 15 minutes.
instructions.4: Lay a damp linen towel on the counter, sprinkle it with confectioner's sugar, and turn the cake onto the towel. Carefully roll the towel up (lengthwise) with the cake in it. Place the cake-in-towel on a cooling rack, and let it cool for 20 minutes.
instructions.5: In a small bowl beat cream until stiff peaks form; set aside. In a large bowl combine cream cheese, 1/3 cup SPLENDA®, and vanilla. Beat until smooth, then fold in whipped cream.
instructions.6: When the cake has cooled 20 minutes, unroll it spread icing onto it. Sprinkle toffee bits evenly over the frosting. Immediately re-roll (not in the towel this time), and wrap it with plastic wrap. Keep the cake refrigerated or freeze it for up to 2 weeks in aluminum foil. Cut the cake in slices just before serving.

questions.question: In Step 6, is the cake from Step 4 being used?
Is cake from Step 4 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is mixture from Step 2 still available in Step 5?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 3?
If we skip Step 4, is it still valid to keep the cake in Step 6?
Can we mix (Step 2) and bake (Step 3) at the same time?
